 # Try to find any cyclical dependencies in the plan's issue sources, and remediate them. This includes (non-total list):
 ## Any Jira issue that is listed in the "Issue Navigator" with a yellow (!) icon under *Parent Link* field. This indicates the link is not valid for ARJ's hierarchy
 !image-2021-02-15-15-50-25-132.png|thumbnail!
 ## An epic that is linked to an Initiative, that is then linked back to the Epic.
 # Create a new plan with the same issue sources, and do not add the "Progress (Issue count)" field.
fields.summary: Too much recursion error when loading plans with cyclical dependancies

fields.description:
h2. Context

Jira provides as default fields "Affects Versions" and "Fix Versions". Advanced Roadmaps makes use of "Fix Versions" for planning purpose.
h2. Suggestion

Introduce additional custom field "Planned Versions" for planning purpose (where currently "Fix Versions" is used). With this, usage of "Fix Version" is left untouched based on business use case of Jira installations.

In case of my organization, "Fix Version" is used to determine actual delivery. We have introduced custom field "Planned Version" even by need for planning, even before starting using Advanced Roadmaps. Now, with Advanced Roadmaps in use we miss it there.
fields.summary: Introduction of "Planned Versions" field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we set a Parent Link as required field (e.g. using a custom workflow validator on "Create" transition), Roadmaps won't be able to commit those issues to Jira when created from within a plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # For an issue type, specify Parent Link as required by means of a custom workflow validator (e.g. JSU "Fields Required" workflow validator in Create transition)
 # Try to create that issue type in Roadmaps, and then commit those to Jira.

h3. Expected Results

Issue is committed successfully because the parent link is set by Portfolio automatically.

h3. Actual Results

Unable to commit the issue, getting exception:

{noformat}2021-02-10 14:36:08,445+0100 http-nio-8080-exec-24 WARN admin 876x3510x1 xrlx1b 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jpo/1.0/issues/commit [c.a.r.j.c.scenario.common.BaseScenarioEntityCommitService] Error in commit operation.
com.atlassian.rm.jpo.env.issues.EnvironmentIssueCreateException: Specific error details: {customfield_10305=Parent Link is required.}{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Remove the workflow validator on Parent Link.
fields.summary: Unable to commit issues when their parent link is set as required field

fields.description:
When I view multiple Projects within the Plan view of AdvancedRoadmaps, I then group by Projects, and view colours by Project each project changes to a colour HOWEVER the releases regardless of project all remain the same colour - It would be great to be able to see release colour correspond to project colour.

 

I have done a quick mock up to show you what I mean, when a senior manager / director wants to over view multiple projects with multiple releases depending on which project seeing all the releases as one colour isn't great.

 

!image-2021-02-11-10-54-27-931.png!
fields.summary: Version colour to be dictated by Project colour within Advanced Roadmap

fields.description: As a user, We'd like to extract the capacity hours per week and per team data from an Advanced Roadmaps plan using API.
fields.summary: To provide REST API endpoint to retrieve capacity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on "View in Issue Navigator" on Pie Chart Gadget including Team field fails for the field options when there are more than one Team fields
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira
 # Install Advance Roadmaps plugin
 # Go to the Custom Fields page and create another *Team* field (or more). Then, you will have two fields (newly created fields + original TEam field comes with Portfolio plugin)
 # Add some option to your original Team field
 # Go to the filters page and create a filter that includes the original Team field with some options:
{code:java}
project = TEST AND cf[10107] = 2 ORDER BY created DESC
{code}

 # Go to one of the dashboards and add a Pie Chart gadget
 ** Choose your created filter for the *Project or Saved Filter* field
 ** Statistic Type = Team (original one)
 # Right-click one of the areas on the Pie Chart and then click on "View in Issue Navigator"

h3. Expected Results

Jira should find a value for the Team field that comes with the Advanced Roadmaps plugin
h3. Actual Results

Jira randomly gets a Team field and searches the value for that field and fails:
 * Executed JQL after clicking on
{code:java}
project = TEST AND cf[10107] = 2 AND Team= 2 ORDER BY created DESC
{code}

 * Error
{code:java}
The option XXX for field 'Team' does not exist
{code}

h3. Workaround

Rename all other Team custom fields and leave only the one that comes with the Advanced Roadmap plugin.
fields.summary: Clicking on "View in Issue Navigator" on Pie Chart Gadget including Team field fails when there are more than one Team fields

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a subtask gets created after the parent issue gets associated with Team, the plan will not show the subtask has inherited Team value from its Parent. This is reproducible intermittently.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create parent issue ABC-1 > associate with Team value
# Create subtask under ABC 1, lets say issue key = ABC-2
# Refresh the plan

h3. Expected result
The plan will show ABC-2 (subtask) has Team field value same as its parent's team field value

h3. Actual Result
* The plan shows blank Team for ABC-2 (subtask)
!planteam.png|thumbnail!
* The JQL result will be inconsistent as well.
!jqlteam.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1

Seems to be breaking the index, so user can:
* Run project reindexing, OR
* Remove and readd the team value for parent issue ABC-1 on the plan, then apply the changes back to Jira via *Review changes*

h4. Workaround 2
# Add this system property to disable filtering indexers by value ( [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] )
{code}
-Djira.cfv.driven.indexing.disabled=true
{code}
(i) You can learn more about this property from  [Optimizing custom fields |https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/optimizing-custom-fields-1005343684.html#Optimizingcustomfields-HowdoIdisablethisfeature]
# Restart Jira
# Perform a full re-index.
fields.summary: Plan doesn't show Team field value for subtasks created after its parent is associated with Team intermittently
